required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ABT-414 in Subjects With Newly Diagnosed Glioblastoma (GBM) With Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Amplification
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo Controlled Phase 3 Study of ABT-414 With Concurrent Chemoradiation and Adjuvant Temozolomide in Subjects With Newly Diagnosed Glioblastoma (GBM) With Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor (EGFR) Amplification (Intellance1)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study seeks to determine whether the addition of ABT-414 to concomitant radiotherapy and temozolomide (TMZ) followed by combination of ABT-414 with adjuvant TMZ prolongs overall survival (OS) among participants with newly diagnosed glioblastoma (GBM) with epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) amplification.
In addition, there is a Phase 1, open-label, multicenter sub-study to assess the pharmacokinetics, safety and tolerability of ABT-414 in participants with newly diagnosed EGFR-amplified GBM who have mild or moderate hepatic impairment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Quarterly after treatment discontinuation for approximately 4 years
primary_outcome.description: Time to OS is defined as the number of days from the date of randomization to the date of death due to any cause.

arm_group.description: Placebo is given on Day 1 of Week 1, 3 and 5 along with the standard therapy of TMZ and radiation during the chemoradiation phase. Placebo is given on Day 1 & 15 of each cycle along with TMZ (Days 1-5 of each cycle) per standard of care during the adjuvant phase.

ABT-414 is given on Day 1 of Week 1, 3 and 5 along with the standard therapy of TMZ and radiation during the chemoradiation phase. ABT-414 is given on Day 1 & 15 of each cycle along with TMZ (Days 1-5 of each cycle) per standard of care during the adjuvant phase.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Must have a clinical diagnosis of Glioblastoma (GBM)
2. Must have a confirmed Epidermal growth factor receptor amplification in tumor tissue
3. Must have a Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS) >= 70 at assessment <= 14 days prior to randomization (N/A to the sub-study).
4. Must have recovered from effects of surgery, postoperative infection and other complications of surgery
5. Must have adequate bone marrow, renal, and hepatic function (For the sub-study, the subject must have adequate bone marrow and renal function and have mild-to-moderate hepatic impairment)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Multifocal, recurrent or metastatic Glioblastoma (GBM) or gliomatosis cerebri (For the sub-study, the subject can have multifocal GBM and gliomatosis cerebri but can't have recurrent or metastatic GBM)
2. Prior chemo therapy or radiosensitizer for head and neck cancer
3. Prior radiotherapy to the head or neck in overlap of radiation fields
4. Prior therapy for glioblastoma or other invasive malignancy
5. Prior, concomitant or planned treatment with Novo-TTF, EGFR-targeted therapy, bevacizumab, Gliadel wafers or other intratumoral or intracavity anti-neoplastic therapy

link.description: can search for the study and find research centers participating

patient_data.ipd_description: AbbVie is committed to responsible data sharing regarding the clinical trials we sponsor. This includes access to anonymized, individual and trial-level data (analysis data sets), as well as other information (e.g., protocols and clinical study reports), as long as the trials are not part of an ongoing or planned regulatory submission. This includes requests for clinical trial data for unlicensed products and indications.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data requests can be submitted at any time and the data will be accessible for 12 months, with possible extensions considered.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Access to this clinical trial data can be requested by any qualified researchers who engage in rigorous, independent scientific research, and will be provided following review and approval of a research proposal and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and execution of a Data Sharing Agreement (DSA). For more information on the process, or to submit a request, visit the following link.
